thread.title: What is behind Stanford's offensive resurgence?

author: Murder charge in road-rage killing of girl, 4
title: What is behind Stanford's offensive resurgence?
text:
What is behind Stanford's offensive resurgence? FOXSports 21 hrs ago © Bob Stanton-USA TODAY Sports Sep 21, 2013; Stanford, CA, USA; Stanford Cardinal quarterback Kevin Hogan (8) changes a play at the line during the first quarter against the Arizona State Sun Devils at Stanford Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Bob Stanton-USA TODAY Sports
Stanford's season-opening loss to Northwestern was an mitigated disaster, especially offensively. However the Cardinal have rebounded in spectacular fashion.
AdChoices In the loss to Northwestern, Stanford scored only six points and averaged 3.9 yards per play. However, in the five games since that loss, the Cardinal are averaging 45 points per gam and 7.3 yards per play. Stanford is also converting 53 percent of its third-down chances. The team converted only 20 percent of those opportunities against Northwestern.
How did the Cardinal turn it around so quickly? Well, there quite a few reasons, including a stronger, more cohesive offensive line and the play of sophomore superstar Christian McCaffrey.
Number coinciding w Stanford's post-NW offensive resurgence: They're lining up under center nearly 2x as often -- https://t.co/DmvLcQQbek
— David Lombardi (@LombardiESPN) October 21, 2015 However, the Cardinal have also been lining up under center more. As a result, the run game has become stronger and QB Kevin Hogan has found more success down the field out the play-action.
Against Northwestern, the Cardinal only lined up under center 19 times. However, over the past five games Stanford has averaged 35.2 snaps per game from under center, per ESPN.
